item.title: 特朗普关税与中国碰撞，震撼 115 万亿美元全球经济
item.description:
在中美未来愿景对决激化的不确定性时代，全球投资者正试图对风险重新定价。【原文：

Investors the world over are trying to reprice risk in an age of uncertainty inflamed by dueling US and Chinese visions for the future.

】

item.title: 日本关税神话不会破灭
item.description:
为什么日本的街道上没有美国汽车？这并不神秘，因为它们不够好。【原文：

Why are Japanese streets empty of US cars? It’s no mystery — they're not good enough.

】

item.title: Meta 公司因前雇员索赔问题引起国会审查
item.description: 美国国会议员正在调查 Facebook 一名前雇员的指控，即首席执行官马克-扎克伯格（Mark Zuckerberg）在公司努力在中国推出社交网络一事上向国会撒谎。【原文：US lawmakers are probing a claim made by a former Facebook employee that Chief Executive Officer Mark Zuckerberg lied to Congress about the company’s efforts to launch its social network in China.】

item.title: 苹果客户在关税前抢购 iPhone
item.description: 特朗普政府威胁征收巨额新关税，导致苹果公司股价暴跌，但也带来了短期的好处：顾客纷纷前往零售店购买 iPhone。【原文：The Trump administration’s threat of massive new tariffs has sent Apple Inc.’s share price plummeting, but it also brought a short-term benefit: customers rushing to retail stores to buy iPhones.】

item.title: MercadoLibre 将在巴西投资 58 亿美元，招聘 1.4 万名员工
item.description: 拉丁美洲价值最高的公司 MercadoLibre Inc. 计划今年将在巴西的投资以当地货币计算增加 48%，重点放在物流、技术和营销方面，同时增聘 14,000 名员工。【原文：MercadoLibre Inc., Latin America’s most-valuable company, plans to ramp up investments in Brazil by 48% in local currency this year focused on logistics, technology and marketing while hiring an additional 14,000 people.】

item.title: 博通公司在股价下跌后回购 100 亿美元股票
item.description: 苹果公司和其他大型科技公司的半导体供应商博通公司（Broadcom Inc.【原文：Broadcom Inc., a supplier of semiconductors to Apple Inc. and other big tech companies, announced plans to buy back as much as $10 billion in shares, saying it remains confident in the chip industry.】

item.title: 特朗普再次推迟美国的 TikTok 禁令。下一步是什么？
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统在就任第二任总统之初采取的首批行动之一就是批准暂缓执行 TikTok 法案。两个半月后，他又批准了第二次暂缓执行。【原文：One of the first actions President Donald Trump took at the outset of his second presidency was granting a stay of execution for TikTok. Two and a half months later, he granted a second.】

item.title: 首席大法官暂停下令遣返被错误驱逐的男子
item.description: 美国首席大法官暂时中止了要求唐纳德-特朗普总统的政府遣返一名马里兰州男子的命令，移民官员承认这名男子被错误地驱逐到了他的祖国萨尔瓦多的一所臭名昭著的监狱。【原文：The US chief justice temporarily paused an order requiring President Donald Trump’s administration to bring back a Maryland man who immigration officials conceded was wrongly deported to a notorious prison in his native El Salvador.】

item.title: 华尔街担忧关税，星巴克到高盛股票评级被下调
item.description: 在唐纳德-特朗普总统宣布全面征收关税后，市场分析师们利用周末时间撕毁了他们的模型，并全面下调了股票评级。【原文：Sellside analysts spent their weekends ripping up their models and downgrading stocks across the board after President Donald Trump’s sweeping tariff announcement ratcheted up expectations for a downturn.】

item.title: 交易员警惕大幅震荡的美股出现虚假反弹
item.description: 一些投资者警告说，在买入机会出现之前，美股已经令人痛苦的大跌很可能会变得更糟。【原文：Some investors are warning an already-painful selloff in US stocks is likely to get worse before a buying opportunity emerges.】

item.title: 内塔尼亚胡寻求关税突破，誓言消除美国贸易赤字
item.description: 以色列总理本雅明-内塔尼亚胡（Benjamin Netanyahu）在与美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）会晤时表示，以色列将努力消除与美国之间的贸易壁垒和赤字，同时寻求对等关税的缓和。【原文：Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said his country would work to eliminate trade barriers and deficits with the US during a meeting with President Donald Trump as he sought a reprieve from reciprocal tariffs.】

item.title: 股市暴跌。别指望美联储会出手相救
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）不断升级的贸易战引发了全球金融市场的暴跌，这在周一引发了美联储可能进行干预以阻止损失的猜测。几位美联储观察人士说，不要指望它。【原文：A brutal global selloff in financial markets triggered by President Donald Trump’s burgeoning trade war raised speculation on Monday the Federal Reserve may intervene to stem the losses. Don’t count on it, several Fed watchers said.】

item.title: 关税激怒市场，贝莱德选择短期国债
item.description: 贝莱德公司的研究部门建议投资者持有 "类似现金 "的短期美债，以抵御市场波动和贸易战升级导致的全球股市下跌。【原文：BlackRock Inc.’s research arm recommends that investors hold short-maturity US debt “akin to cash” as a shield against market gyrations and a global rout in stocks driven by the escalating trade war.】

item.title: 美国消费者借贷在广泛回调中意外下降
item.description: 2 月份美国消费者借贷出乎意料地出现了三个月来的首次下降，反映出信用卡余额的大幅回落以及机动车和其他非循环贷款的减少。【原文：US consumer borrowing unexpectedly declined in February for the first time in three months, reflecting a sharp pullback in credit-card balances and a decrease in motor vehicle and other non-revolving loans.】

item.title: 特朗普关税已对世界贸易造成的影响
item.description:
企业已经开始行动。【原文：

Business are already making moves.

】

item.title: 奇货可居：特朗普的关税已经影响到贸易 (播客)
item.description: 就在上周三，特朗普总统宣布了他与世界其他国家的新关税计划。这已经产生了影响。企业争先恐后地将货物装上飞机或船只，以赶在第一个截止日期之前交货。一些公司已经在试图解除现有合同。一些先前计划的工厂项目甚至被搁置。在本期节目中，我们采访了 Flexport 公司的创始人兼首席执行官 Ryan Petersen，请他谈谈他从这一趋势中已经看到了什么。【原文：It was just last Wednesday that President Trump announced his new tariff schedule with the rest of the world. And it’s already having an effect. Companies are scrambling to get goods on planes or boats to beat the first deadline. Companies are already trying to get out of existing contracts. And some previously planned factory endeavors have even been put on hold. On this episode, we speak with Ryan Petersen, the founder and CEO of Flexport, to talk about what he’s already seeing from the perspe】

item.title: 在市场疲软之际，Codelco 老板对铜的基本面保持信心
item.description: 全球最大的铜供应商 Codelco 表示，在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的贸易战引发金融市场动荡的情况下，铜的实际需求依然强劲。【原文：Codelco, the world’s biggest copper supplier, says physical demand for the metal has remained strong amid all the upheaval in financial markets triggered by US President Donald Trump’s trade war.】

item.title: 美国 IPO 银行家在特朗普关税计划终止后面临 "瘫痪
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的关税打击导致交易搁浅之后，银行家们正试图找出美国首次公开募股可能恢复的时间。【原文：Bankers are trying to game out when US initial public offerings could potentially recover after the blow dealt by President Donald Trump’s tariffs put deals on hold.】

item.title: 杠杆赌注前所未有地主导关税航线交易
item.description: 上周末，随着全球股市在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的关税暴击后大幅走低，在价值 10 万亿美元的美国交易所交易基金市场上出现了一种引人注目的模式。【原文：Late last week, as stocks across the globe lurched lower in the wake of US President Donald Trump’s tariff blitz, a striking pattern emerged in the $10 trillion US market for exchange-traded funds.】

item.title: 石油交易商以创纪录的期权赌注对冲经济衰退
item.description: 投资者正加大对价格跌破 60 美元的押注，以对冲更广泛的经济衰退。【原文：Investors are dialing up wagers on prices slumping below $60 in a hedge against a wider economic downturn.】

item.title: 科拉诺维奇认为特朗普结束关税 "小丑秀 "将拯救股市
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统坚称，他永远不会改变使全球市场陷入动荡的贸易政策。马尔科-科拉诺维奇（Marko Kolanovic）认为，总统似乎快要向这种压力屈服了。【原文：President Donald Trump insists he’ll never change the trade policies that have plunged global markets into turmoil. To Marko Kolanovic, it looks like the president is close to caving to that pressure.】

item.title: 市场混乱令华尔街警惕美国资金紧张
item.description: 由于美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的关税政策导致投资者大规模抛售美国资产，投资者正在美元融资市场上寻找混乱迹象。【原文：Investors are scouring US dollar funding markets for signs of disruptions as President Donald Trump’s tariffs causes investors to dump American assets en masse.】

item.title: 欧盟考虑在金属争端中对部分美国商品征收 25% 的关税
item.description: 欧盟提议对部分美国商品征收 25% 的关税，以报复唐纳德-特朗普总统上个月决定对铝和钢材进口征税。【原文：The European Union is proposing to impose 25% tariffs on a selection of US goods in retaliation for President Donald Trump’s decision last month to put levies on aluminum and steel imports.】

item.title: 伦敦三月份黄金流入，套利交易减少
item.description: 伦敦金库的黄金储存量在 3 月份有所上升，这是自 10 月份以来的首次月度增长，因为有迹象表明，由于贵金属被免除了最近的关税，吸引了价值数百亿美元的金银到美国的有利可图的套利交易已经结束。【原文：The amount of gold stored in London vaults edged higher in March, the first monthly increase since October, amid signs that a lucrative arbitrage trade that’s drawn tens of billions of dollars’ worth of bullion to the US has come to an end as precious metals were exempted from recent tariffs.】

item.title: 加拿大卡尼表示，特朗普的贸易战正将美国推向衰退
item.description: 加拿大总理马克-卡尼（Mark Carney）说，唐纳德-特朗普的关税政策是一种自我破坏经济的行为，正在将美国推向衰退。【原文：Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney said Donald Trump’s tariff policy is an act of economic self-sabotage that’s pushing the US into a downturn.】

item.title: 拉里-芬克致纽约整治犯罪、脏乱差或失去更多公司
item.description: 贝莱德公司（BlackRock Inc.首席执行官拉里-芬克（Larry Fink）说，纽约饱受犯罪和脏乱差的困扰，而且缺乏足够的好学校，他呼吁政界人士为金融公司在纽约开展业务提供更多便利。【原文：BlackRock Inc. Chief Executive Officer Larry Fink said New York is plagued by crime and filth and lacks enough good schools, and he called on politicians to make it easier for financial firms to do business in the city.】

item.title: Binance 创始人赵明将帮助巴基斯坦推动加密货币交易竞标
item.description: 巴基斯坦已邀请全球最大的加密货币交易所 Binance 的联合创始人赵长鹏在这个南亚国家建立一个具有全球竞争力的数字金融平台。【原文：Pakistan has roped in Changpeng Zhao, the co-founder of the world’s largest crypto exchange Binance, to set up a globally competitive platform for digital finance in the South Asian nation.】

item.title: 印度贸易部长称印度对美国商品征收的关税并非 "巨额 "关税
item.description: 印度商务部长皮尤什-戈亚尔（Piyush Goyal）周一表示，印度从美国进口的实际关税并不高，因为这个南亚国家正试图摆脱美国总统唐纳德-特朗普给它贴上的 "关税之王 "标签。【原文：India’s actual tariffs on imports from the US were not high, Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal said on Monday, as the South Asian nation sought to shake off the ‘tariff king’ label put on it by US President Donald Trump.】

item.title: 这太疯狂了震撼股市的 15 分钟
item.description: 上午 10 点刚过，曼哈顿市中心的 Siebert 交易大厅里爆发出一阵喊叫声。公司首席投资官马克-马利克（Mark Malek）冲出办公室，听到他的首席交易员大喊，唐纳德-特朗普总统正在权衡是否要暂停连日来令股市下挫的全面关税措施。【原文：At just after 10 a.m., shouting erupted on the Siebert trading floor in downtown Manhattan. Mark Malek, the firm’s chief investment officer, rushed out of his office to hear his head trader screaming that President Donald Trump was weighing suspending the across-the-board tariff roll-out that had been sinking stock markets for days.】

item.title: 谷物期货大幅波动，交易商对关税头条做出反应
item.description: 投资者对唐纳德-特朗普总统贸易政策的一系列头条新闻作出反应，谷物大幅波动。【原文：Grains swung sharply as investors reacted to a flurry of headlines related to President Donald Trump’s trade policies.】
